description:
Wikispecies 
From Middle English loche, from Old French loche, further origin uncertain, possibly from Vulgar Latin *laukka (“loach”), which could be from Gaulish *leuca (“loach, slug”), also attested as the feminine name Leuca, from leux (“bright, light”), a reference to  slugs' bright appearance, the fish later being associated due to similarities to the slug.

definitionGroups.group: A bottom-feeding freshwater fish in the superfamily or suborder Cobitoidea.

entries.meaning: Any true loach, of the family Cobitidae.
A similar fish in one of three other families of Cypriniformes: Botiidae, Balitoridae, and Gyrinocheilidae.

description: From the pronunciation of the acronym LOH (“loach”).
